column4: for instance, I cant set my screen resoultion to 1920x1080 like I could on Win7
thats what it tells me when its done scanning for drivers
also, how do I get to the console window? :P
I thought this was the idea behind linux?
so I basiclly cant use my videocard to the fullest unless im willing to pay? :o
it means you can't have free access to change the code of the driver.
'sub-folders' in /dev/ are representations of the hardware devices

for example, if you have a second hard drive  that is not mounted called "/dev/sdb", you can mount it by creating a destination in /mnt ( sudo mkdir /mnt/newdrivename ) and then attaching that device there ( sudo mount /dev/sdb1/ /mnt/newdrivename )
if you can see it in the gui, it is mounted somewhere already
aha I see, so their not actual partitions anymore, but folders
